channel.title: Finding passwords? -SOLVED-
channel.description: If you would decompile the Runescape client. Then finding the login method. And if you find the part where the client compares the password with the user name and print that piece out. Then can you basically find all passwords right?

item.title: Finding passwords? -SOLVED-
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

EDIT - I read the topic wrong, but it’s the same concept. Like people said you can’t find other passwords because they are compared on the server and not the client. And there is no legitimate reason to want to find the method to log them either

Read full topic

item.title: Finding passwords? -SOLVED-
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

zyle1992:

The client compares nothing. The login data is sent encoded to the server, the server compares the passwords (probably not in plain text) and sends back to the server whether it was successful or not.

But he can log the attempted password fairly easily

Read full topic

item.title: Finding passwords? -SOLVED-
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

The client compares nothing. The login data is sent encoded to the server, the server compares the passwords (probably not in plain text) and sends back to the server whether it was successful or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Finding passwords? -SOLVED-
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

[quote=“pkkid, post:4, topic:445720”][quote author=Native^ link=topic=548556.msg4021280#msg4021280 date=1340042174]
I’m not sure what you mean with ‘all passwords’, because if you hack your client you will only see your password.
[/quote]
Well the client will compare the password with the password at the server so if you print that out you would see the password.[/quote]
Yes, but that is server sided. The server and client communicate with each other by sending bytes (obviously). In lower engine clients the byte for correct login is the value 2, for wrong password value three 3.

Read full topic

item.title: Finding passwords? -SOLVED-
item.dc:creator: @pkkid pkkid
item.description:
@pkkid wrote:

Native^:

I’m not sure what you mean with ‘all passwords’, because if you hack your client you will only see your password.

Well the client will compare the password with the password at the server so if you print that out you would see the password.

Read full topic
